bibl.title: Letter from George W. Sternberg to Aristides Agramonte, June 5, 1899

div1.p: Sternberg sends checks for research-related expenses.

div1.head: Letter from George W. Sternberg to Aristides Agramonte, June 5, 1899
div1.p:
June 5, 1899. Major Walter Reed,
Surgeon U. S. Army,
Curator, Army Medical Museum.
Dear Doctor:-

Enclosed I send you my check for Fifty
Dollars, to be used for the purchase of ani-
mals and food for the same, in connection with
your investigations relating to bacillus icter-
oides.

Very truly yours,
George W. Sternberg
Surgeon General, U.S. Army.

June 5, 1899. Dr. Aristides Agramonte,
Acting Asst. Surgeon, U. S. A.,
Havana, Cuba.
Dear Doctor:-

Enclosed I send you my check for One Hun-
dred Dollars, to be used by you for the purchase
of animals and other incidental expenses in con-
nection with your investigations.

Very truly yours,
George W. Sternberg
Surgeon General, U.S. Army.
